intro.description: This CheatSheet is a tutotial for using the JavaScript Console in Bioclipse.

item.title: Step 1: Show the JavaScript Console
item.description:
Bioclipse scripting is built on JavaScript, so to be able to enter scripting commands we need to reveal the JavaScript View.
To show available views, use the main menu option Window > Show View > Other.... In the opened Views dialog, select the JavaScript View.

item.title: Step 2: Listing available Managers
item.description:
Managers are collection of functionality in a domain, contributed by a plugin. For example, the CDK Manager has functionality to load/save/manipulate chemical structures.
To list available managers, enter help in the JavaScript Console.
Hint: You type the commands in the small window at the bottom of the JavaScript View, and the results are shown in the window above.

item.title: Step 3: Getting help about a manager
item.description:
To get help for a manager, enter the command:
help <manager>
Try to see the help for the CDK manager with: help cdk

item.title: Step 4: Explore tab completion
item.description:
The JavaScript Console is equipped with tab completion. Simply click the tab key to reveal the core namespaces that are available.
A namespace is a grouping of functionality, for example does the cdk namespace group CDK functionality. Write 'cdk.' ending with a dot, and click the tab key again. Now you will see the methods the cdk namespaces offer.

item.title: Step 5: Some basic JavaScript commands
item.description:
Try the following command, they are quite self-explanatory:
clear()
print("hello world" + (12-4))

item.title: Step 6: More information
item.description: For more information, see Bioclipse Help.
